This release includes a new feature, serviced and application audit logging.
writes messages to an audit log file on the master host when configuration changes occur in the cluster. The messages record the time, user identity, and information about the change in plain text.
Also, records application audit messages, if an application is configured to write audit messages through . ( is configured for audit logging through , is not.) By default, audit logging requires 10GB of storage on the master host. The upgrade process includes a procedure for adding space to the master host, if necessary.
